meanings.sent2: People often extoll the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone began to extoll the delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork seemed to extoll the wonders of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would always extoll the virtues of hard work.

meanings.sent1: We extoll the hero for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to extoll the local charity's efforts.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to extoll their favorite cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice seemed to extoll the emotions of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The book will extoll the importance of friendship.

meanings.sent1: I extoll my colleague for his hard work.
meanings.sent2: The coach would always extoll the team's dedication.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to extoll the flavors of the new dish.
meanings.sent4: Her speech seemed to extoll the values of honesty.
meanings.sent5: The mayor will extoll the efforts of the volunteers.
